results.title: Facts about projection
results.creator_credit: Robert Edmonds, Wesley Greene and John Ott Pictures
results.brief_description: Explains how a projectionist can put on a professional 16mm sound film screening by observing a check list of hints and safeguards. Emphasises the importance of a pre-showing check of the kind and source of power, light control facilities and ventilation; of the correct set-up of projector, speaker and screen; placement and plugging of cords; adjustment of focus, screen size, tone and volume controls and a final check for clean aperture before threading.

results.title: Faces in the sun
results.creator_credit: Cecil Holmes, Richard Mason and Methodist Overseas Mission
results.brief_description: The story of four aboriginals grappling with assimilation pressures and facing a changing future. Through the experience of a bark painter, a teaching assistant, a carpenter, and a tribal headman, we see the type of life each one lives, and the conflict of the old and the new which sets up tensions within each one, and in Aboriginal society. (Award: Gold Award, General Category, Australian Film Awards, 1965).

results.title: The Face of Lincoln
results.creator_credit: Edward Freed, Wilbur T. Blume and University of Southern California
results.brief_description: Professor Merrell Gage, head of the Department of Sculpture at the University of Southern California, describes the life and career of Abraham Lincoln as he sculptures from clay a life-like bust of the President, making physical changes in the subject’s face, hair, beard and expression to correspond with events in Lincoln’s life.

results.title: The Only way out
results.brief_description: A study of decentralisation - Australia is already one of the most highly urbanised countries in the world, and municipal and State authorities are finding it difficult to provide the facilities necessary for large populations. Examines moves towards large-scale decentralisation in South Australia and Albury/Wodonga.

results.title: F.A. Cup Final 1962
results.brief_description: Records the 1962 FA Cup Final played at Wembley Stadium between the Tottenham Hotspurs and Burnley. Use of slow motion camera work helps make this an outstanding record of a thrilling final as it follows Burnley’s attempt to stand up to the Spurs team at the peak of their form. The Queen and Prince Phillip were among the thousands of spectators.

results.title: F.A. Cup Final 1960
results.brief_description: The Football Association Challenge Cup Final is one of Britain’s great sporting events of the year. The 1960 Final was played between Blackburn Rovers and Wolverhampton Wanderers. This film attempts to capture the atmosphere of this great event played at Wembley Stadium near London before a crowd of 100,000 spectators.

results.title: F.A. Cup Final 1954
results.brief_description: The Football Association Challenge Cup final, 1954, between Preston North End and West Bromwich Albion, played at the Empire Stadium, Wembley. Shows the huge crowds, highlights of the game, and the presentation of the Cup by Queen Elizabeth, the Queen Mother.

results.title: Eye Witness. No. 81
results.creator_credit: Alvin Goldman, Hector Lemieux, Peter Jones and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine items as follows: New Life for Ghost Town Miners: Aided by the provincial government, jobless mine workers of Alberta move from Nordegg and other abandoned coal-mining areas to obtain new work elsewhere in Canada. School for Frogmen: Officers and men of the Royal Canadian Navy’s Operational Diving Unit at Halifax undergo rigorous training courses to equip them for sub-surface duties.

results.title: Eye Witness. No. 56
results.creator_credit: Felix Lazarus, Hector Lemieux, Ronald Weyman, David Bairstow and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine items as follows: Scottish Shepherd Tries New Pastures: A boost to Newfoundland’s wool and mutton trade is given by Robert Evans, Scottish shepherd and breeder who uses the province’s many acres of grazing land on the Avalon peninsula for a new and profitable industry. Outdoor Classrooms Help Children Catch Up: Children who have fallen behind in their studies find summer school easy to take when lessons are in the pleasant surroundings of Toronto’s High Park. Canadian Experts Help Arab Farmers: Bringing knowledge and skills from where they are known to where they are needed is the job of two Canadian agricultural experts working with the Food and Agriculture Organization in Iraq.

results.title: The Extraordinary experience of Nicholas Nodwell
results.brief_description: Nicholas is usually inattentive at school and likes to daydream. During a lesson on the production and uses of petroleum he finds himself transported into a strange world without petroleum. He learns how much our modern society depends on petroleum products. Script by Frank Colyer.
